p: CAT and SOD are key scavenging enzymes that terminate free radicals ( Sellamuthu et al., 2013). CAT is an endogenous antioxidant enzyme abundantly present in biological tissues, including liver and kidney, and is the most effective defence against hydrogen peroxide (an important reactive oxygen species). Whereas SOD protects the body against oxidative stress by catalysing reactions of superoxide radicals and eventually converting radicals to water and oxygen ( Raj et al., 2016).
